banner.title: Banner
banner.description:
The banner is a common component made up a background image and various pieces of configurable content.
Defaults include a title, description, and a searchbar.
banner.markdownDescription:
The banner is a common component made up a background image and various pieces of configurable content.
Defaults include a title, description, and a searchbar.

align.title: Alignment
align.description: Describes how text contents are horizontally aligned if the contents do not completely fill their container.
align.markdownDescription: Describes how text contents are horizontally aligned if the contents do not completely fill their container.

color.title: Color
color.description: Sets the color the components's text. Hexidecimal colors preferred (Either #RRGGBB or #RRGGBBAA)
color.markdownDescription: Sets the color the components's text. Hexidecimal colors preferred (Either #RRGGBB or #RRGGBBAA)

letterSpacing.title: Letter Spacing
letterSpacing.description: Sets the spacing behavior between text characters.
letterSpacing.markdownDescription: Sets the spacing behavior between text characters.

lineHeight.title: Line Height
lineHeight.description: Sets the distance between lines of text.
lineHeight.markdownDescription: Sets the distance between lines of text.

shadow.title: Text Shadow
shadow.description: Enables shadow effects to be applied to the text of the element. Allows any formats of [the CSS 'text-shadow' property.](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-shadow)
shadow.markdownDescription: Enables shadow effects to be applied to the text of the element. Allows any formats of [the CSS 'text-shadow' property.](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-shadow)

size.title: Size
size.description: Indicates the desired height of glyphs in the applied font. Numerical units will be applied as pixels, for example '12' will be interpreted as '12px'.
size.markdownDescription: Indicates the desired height of glyphs in the applied font. Numerical units will be applied as pixels, for example '12' will be interpreted as '12px'.

textDecoration.title: Text Decoration
textDecoration.description: Apply some decoration to the text.
textDecoration.markdownDescription: Apply some decoration to the text.

transform.title: Transform
transform.description: Specifies how to capitalize an element's text. It can be used to make text appear in all-uppercase or all-lowercase, or with each word capitalized.
transform.markdownDescription: Specifies how to capitalize an element's text. It can be used to make text appear in all-uppercase or all-lowercase, or with each word capitalized.

weight.title: Weight
weight.description: Specifies weight/boldness of glyphs in the applied font.
weight.markdownDescription: Specifies weight/boldness of glyphs in the applied font.

all.title: All
all.description: Set the spacing for all sides of the component. Equivalent to setting the top, bottom, left, and right. Numeric units will be interpreted as pixels.

options.title: Banner - Options
options.description: Control different variants for the banner. These options can affect multiple parts of the banner at once.
options.markdownDescription: Control different variants for the banner. These options can affect multiple parts of the banner at once.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: When disabled the banner will not appear at all.
enabled.markdownDescription: When disabled the banner will not appear at all.

hideIcon.title: Hide Icon
hideIcon.description: Hide icon in banner. Defaults to true.
hideIcon.markdownDescription: Hide icon in banner. Defaults to true.

mobileAlignment.title: Alignment (Mobile)
mobileAlignment.description: Align the banner on mobile. Defaults to match desktop alignment.
mobileAlignment.markdownDescription: Align the banner on mobile. Defaults to match desktop alignment.

searchPlacement.title: SearchBar Placement
searchPlacement.description: Place the search bar in different parts of the banner.
searchPlacement.markdownDescription: Place the search bar in different parts of the banner.

url.title: Title Url
url.description: When set turn the title into a link to this url.
url.markdownDescription: When set turn the title into a link to this url.

attachment.title: attachment
attachment.description: Set the background attachment of the component. [MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-attachment)
attachment.markdownDescription: Set the background attachment of the component. [MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-attachment)

color.title: color
color.description: Set the background color of the component.
color.markdownDescription: Set the background color of the component.

image.title: image
image.description:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".
image.markdownDescription:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

size.markdownDescription: Set the background size of the component. [MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-size)

unsetBackground.title: Ignore Default Background
unsetBackground.description: Some components have a built-in background. In these scenarios setting this variable to true will remove the default background, even if other background properties are not specified.
unsetBackground.markdownDescription: Some components have a built-in background. In these scenarios setting this variable to true will remove the default background, even if other background properties are not specified.

This color is detected automatically, but can be overridden with the
banner.backgrounds.overlayColor variable.

lineHeight.markdownDescription: Sets the distance between lines of text.

shadow.title: Text Shadow

image.title: image
image.description:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

borderType.title: Border Type
borderType.description:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.
borderType.markdownDescription:

- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

attachment.markdownDescription: Set the background attachment of the component. [MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-attachment)

color.title: color
color.description: Set the background color of the component.
color.markdownDescription: Set the background color of the component.

image.title: image
image.description:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".
image.markdownDescription:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

position.title: position
position.description: Set the background position of the component. [MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-position)
position.markdownDescription: Set the background position of the component. [MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-position)

size.markdownDescription: Set the background size of the component. [MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-size)

unsetBackground.title: Ignore Default Background
unsetBackground.description: Some components have a built-in background. In these scenarios setting this variable to true will remove the default background, even if other background properties are not specified.
unsetBackground.markdownDescription: Some components have a built-in background. In these scenarios setting this variable to true will remove the default background, even if other background properties are not specified.

all.title: All
all.description: Set the spacing for all sides of the component. Equivalent to setting the top, bottom, left, and right. Numeric units will be interpreted as pixels.
all.markdownDescription: Set the spacing for all sides of the component. Equivalent to setting the top, bottom, left, and right. Numeric units will be interpreted as pixels.

bottom.title: Bottom
bottom.description: Set the bottom spacing of the component. Numeric units will be interpreted as pixels.
bottom.markdownDescription: Set the bottom spacing of the component. Numeric units will be interpreted as pixels.

horizontal.title: Horizontal
horizontal.description: Set the horizontal spacing of the component. Equivalent to setting the left & right. Numeric units will be interpreted as pixels.
horizontal.markdownDescription: Set the horizontal spacing of the component. Equivalent to setting the left & right. Numeric units will be interpreted as pixels.

left.title: Left

right.title: Right

top.title: Top

top.markdownDescription: Set the top spacing of the component. Numeric units will be interpreted as pixels.

vertical.title: Vertical
vertical.description: Set the vertical spacing of the component. Equivalent to setting the top & bottom. Numeric units will be interpreted as pixels.
vertical.markdownDescription: Set the vertical spacing of the component. Equivalent to setting the top & bottom. Numeric units will be interpreted as pixels.

borderType.title: Border Type
borderType.description:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.
borderType.markdownDescription:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

itemSpacing.title: Depth 1 - Item Spacing
itemSpacing.description: For certain border types, there is space between in items. This is that space in pixels.
itemSpacing.markdownDescription: For certain border types, there is space between in items. This is that space in pixels.

itemSpacingOnAllItems.title: Depth 1 - Apply Item Spacing on all items
itemSpacingOnAllItems.description: Apply the item spacing even on the first and last items.
itemSpacingOnAllItems.markdownDescription: Apply the item spacing even on the first and last items.

vertical.markdownDescription: Set the vertical spacing of the component. Equivalent to setting the top & bottom. Numeric units will be interpreted as pixels.

borderType.title: Border Type
borderType.description:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.
borderType.markdownDescription:
Choose one of a few border types.

- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

itemSpacing.markdownDescription: For certain border types, there is space between in items. This is that space in pixels.

image.title: image

- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

borderType.title: Border Type
borderType.description:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

borderType.title: Border Type
borderType.description:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

image.title: image
image.description:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

Describe how the list items should be separated from each other.
- none - The list items only have whitespace between them.
- border - The list items each have a full border and whitespace between the borders.
- separator - There is whitespace and a single line separating 2 items.

borderType.title: Border Type
borderType.description:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.
borderType.markdownDescription:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

titleBar.title: Title Bar
titleBar.description:
The TitleBar is the sticky navigation bar, normally containing a logo,
navigation links, a searchbar, and the mebox.
titleBar.markdownDescription:
The TitleBar is the sticky navigation bar, normally containing a logo,
navigation links, a searchbar, and the mebox.

color.title: color
color.description: Set the color of the border.
color.markdownDescription: Set the color of the border.

radius.title: radius
radius.description: Set the radius of the border. Numerical units are interpretted as pixels.
radius.markdownDescription: Set the radius of the border. Numerical units are interpretted as pixels.

width.title: width
width.description: Set the width of the border. Numerical units are interpretted as pixels.
width.markdownDescription: Set the width of the border. Numerical units are interpretted as pixels.

bgColor.title: Background Color
bgColor.description:
The background color of the full bleed titlebar when it is transparent/semi-transparent.
This defaults to the normal titleBar.colors.bg color, but can be a different color.
For example, you may want to use a semi-transparent white/black while overlaying the banner,
but want the titlebar to transition a brand color when on it's own or scrolled down the page.
bgColor.markdownDescription:
The background color of the full bleed titlebar when it is transparent/semi-transparent.
This defaults to the normal titleBar.colors.bg color, but can be a different color.
For example, you may want to use a semi-transparent white/black while overlaying the banner,
but want the titlebar to transition a brand color when on it's own or scrolled down the page.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description:
Enable a "full bleed" title bar.
This caused to titlebar to be transparent or semi-transparent and site *on top* of the banner.
enabled.markdownDescription:
Enable a "full bleed" title bar.
This caused to titlebar to be transparent or semi-transparent and site *on top* of the banner.

endingOpacity.title: Ending Opacity
endingOpacity.description:
An opacity value between 0 and 1 that determins how transparent the full bleed titlebar is
as the banner is scrolled out of view.
The banner *always* becomes completely solid after the transition,
so this value only affects the transition between states.
This value cannot be less than the `titleBar.fullBleed.startingOpacity` value.
0 - Fully transparent.
0.3 - Semi transparent.
1 - Completely solid
endingOpacity.markdownDescription:
An opacity value between 0 and 1 that determins how transparent the full bleed titlebar is
as the banner is scrolled out of view.
The banner *always* becomes completely solid after the transition,
so this value only affects the transition between states.
This value cannot be less than the `titleBar.fullBleed.startingOpacity` value.
0 - Fully transparent.
0.3 - Semi transparent.
1 - Completely solid

startingOpacity.title: Starting Opacity
startingOpacity.description:
An opacity value between 0 and 1 that determins how transparent the full bleed titlebar is
when sitting on top of the banner.
0 - Fully transparent.
0.3 - Semi transparent.
1 - Completely solid
startingOpacity.markdownDescription:
An opacity value between 0 and 1 that determins how transparent the full bleed titlebar is
when sitting on top of the banner.
0 - Fully transparent.
0.3 - Semi transparent.
1 - Completely solid

maxWidth.title: Max Width
maxWidth.description: Maximum pixel width to the display the logo on mobile device sizes.
maxWidth.markdownDescription: Maximum pixel width to the display the logo on mobile device sizes.

doubleLogoStrategy.title: Double Logo Strategy
doubleLogoStrategy.description:
A strategy for dealing with multiple logos when using a custom theme header with the titlebar.
- visible (default) - Always show the logo in the titlebar.
- hidden - Hide the logo in the titlebar.
- fade-in - Fade the logo in after the custom theme header scrolls of the page.
doubleLogoStrategy.markdownDescription:
A strategy for dealing with multiple logos when using a custom theme header with the titlebar.
- visible (default) - Always show the logo in the titlebar.
- hidden - Hide the logo in the titlebar.
- fade-in - Fade the logo in after the custom theme header scrolls of the page.

justifyContent.title: Logo Placement
justifyContent.description: Where to place the logo in the TitleBar.
justifyContent.markdownDescription: Where to place the logo in the TitleBar.

maxWidth.title: Max Width
maxWidth.description: Maximum pixel width to the display the logo.
maxWidth.markdownDescription: Maximum pixel width to the display the logo.

offsetRight.title: Right Margin
offsetRight.description: Apply some spacing between the logo and the navigation items.
offsetRight.markdownDescription: Apply some spacing between the logo and the navigation items.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description:
Create a curved bottom border on the Title Bar.
Larger numbers give a bigger "swoop". Please note that this adds some additional space into the bottom of the titlebar.
A value of 10 gives a very subtle swoop that should not require much adjustment elsewhere.
A value of 50 gives a very pronounced swoop and will require adjustments in padding to compensate.
The follow variables should be used together to fine your desired swoop.
amount.markdownDescription:
Create a curved bottom border on the Title Bar.
Larger numbers give a bigger "swoop". Please note that this adds some additional space into the bottom of the titlebar.
A value of 10 gives a very subtle swoop that should not require much adjustment elsewhere.
A value of 50 gives a very pronounced swoop and will require adjustments in padding to compensate.
The follow variables should be used together to fine your desired swoop.

swoopOffset.title: Offset
swoopOffset.description:
This parameter determines how much the swoop extends "outside" of the TitleBar
Large offsets may require adjustments in padding.
The follow variables should be used together to fine your desired swoop.
swoopOffset.markdownDescription:
This parameter determines how much the swoop extends "outside" of the TitleBar
Large offsets may require adjustments in padding.

bg.title: Foreground Color (State)
bg.description:
The foreground hover/state color for various buttons in the Title Bar.
It is recommended that this color have strong contrast with the background color.
By default this color is generated based on the regular color.
bg.markdownDescription:
The foreground hover/state color for various buttons in the Title Bar.
It is recommended that this color have strong contrast with the background color.
By default this color is generated based on the regular color.

bg.title: Background Color
bg.description:
Background color for the titlebar.
It's recommended that this color have sufficient color with the foreground color.
bg.markdownDescription:
Background color for the titlebar.
It's recommended that this color have sufficient color with the foreground color.

bgImage.title: Background Image
bgImage.description:
Apply a background image over the Title Bar.
This image will will fill the full background of the Title Bar and will not be stretched.
It's recommended to use a very wide patterned image,
of which the middle portion make sense on it's own (for mobile devices.)
This should be a full URL to an image.

- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

top.title: Top

vertical.title: Vertical
vertical.description: Set the vertical spacing of the component. Equivalent to setting the top & bottom. Numeric units will be interpreted as pixels.
vertical.markdownDescription: Set the vertical spacing of the component. Equivalent to setting the top & bottom. Numeric units will be interpreted as pixels.

borderType.title: Border Type
borderType.description:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.
borderType.markdownDescription:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

itemSpacing.title: User Spotlight - Box - Item Spacing
itemSpacing.description: For certain border types, there is space between in items. This is that space in pixels.
itemSpacing.markdownDescription: For certain border types, there is space between in items. This is that space in pixels.

itemSpacingOnAllItems.title: User Spotlight - Box - Apply Item Spacing on all items
itemSpacingOnAllItems.description: Apply the item spacing even on the first and last items.
itemSpacingOnAllItems.markdownDescription: Apply the item spacing even on the first and last items.

attachment.title: attachment
attachment.description: Set the background attachment of the component. [MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-attachment)
attachment.markdownDescription: Set the background attachment of the component. [MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-attachment)

color.title: color
color.description: Set the background color of the component.
color.markdownDescription: Set the background color of the component.

image.title: image
image.description:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".
image.markdownDescription:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

borderType.title: Border Type
borderType.description:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

borderType.title: Border Type
borderType.description:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.
borderType.markdownDescription:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

itemSpacingOnAllItems.description: Apply the item spacing even on the first and last items.

spacer.title: Spacers
spacer.description:
Commonly used spacing in components and around them. This is the primary place to adjust spacing of the site overall.
Component spacings collapse when next to each other where possible.
spacer.markdownDescription:
Commonly used spacing in components and around them. This is the primary place to adjust spacing of the site overall.

headingBox.title: Heading Box
headingBox.description: Controls spacing below heading boxes (a heading box includes a title, optional description, and optional subtitle). This will be used in addition to the `headingItem` spacing.
headingBox.markdownDescription: Controls spacing below heading boxes (a heading box includes a title, optional description, and optional subtitle). This will be used in addition to the `headingItem` spacing.

headingBoxCompact.title: Heading Box Compact
headingBoxCompact.description:
Controls inside small components with borders or shadows around them.
**This compact version is used on viewport sizes.**
headingBoxCompact.markdownDescription:
Controls inside small components with borders or shadows around them.

mainLayout.title: Main Layout
mainLayout.description:
Controls spacing around main layouts like panel layouts.
When there are breadcrumbs this controls above the breadcrumbs.
mainLayout.markdownDescription:

pageComponentCompact.title: Page Component Compact

Additionally this value is used for widgets placed inside of the main panel in panel layouts on all device sizes.

lineHeight.markdownDescription: Sets the distance between lines of text.

shadow.title: Text Shadow
shadow.description: Enables shadow effects to be applied to the text of the element. Allows any formats of [the CSS 'text-shadow' property.](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-shadow)
shadow.markdownDescription: Enables shadow effects to be applied to the text of the element. Allows any formats of [the CSS 'text-shadow' property.](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-shadow)

size.title: Size
size.description: Indicates the desired height of glyphs in the applied font. Numerical units will be applied as pixels, for example '12' will be interpreted as '12px'.
size.markdownDescription: Indicates the desired height of glyphs in the applied font. Numerical units will be applied as pixels, for example '12' will be interpreted as '12px'.

textDecoration.title: Text Decoration
textDecoration.description: Apply some decoration to the text.
textDecoration.markdownDescription: Apply some decoration to the text.

transform.title: Transform
transform.description: Specifies how to capitalize an element's text. It can be used to make text appear in all-uppercase or all-lowercase, or with each word capitalized.
transform.markdownDescription: Specifies how to capitalize an element's text. It can be used to make text appear in all-uppercase or all-lowercase, or with each word capitalized.

weight.title: Weight
weight.description: Specifies weight/boldness of glyphs in the applied font.
weight.markdownDescription: Specifies weight/boldness of glyphs in the applied font.

all.title: All

bottom.title: Bottom

bottom.markdownDescription: Set the bottom spacing of the component. Numeric units will be interpreted as pixels.

horizontal.title: Horizontal
horizontal.description: Set the horizontal spacing of the component. Equivalent to setting the left & right. Numeric units will be interpreted as pixels.
horizontal.markdownDescription: Set the horizontal spacing of the component. Equivalent to setting the left & right. Numeric units will be interpreted as pixels.

left.title: Left

left.markdownDescription: Set the left spacing of the component. Numeric units will be interpreted as pixels.

right.title: Right

top.title: Top
top.description: Set the top spacing of the component. Numeric units will be interpreted as pixels.
top.markdownDescription: Set the top spacing of the component. Numeric units will be interpreted as pixels.

vertical.title: Vertical
vertical.description: Set the vertical spacing of the component. Equivalent to setting the top & bottom. Numeric units will be interpreted as pixels.
vertical.markdownDescription: Set the vertical spacing of the component. Equivalent to setting the top & bottom. Numeric units will be interpreted as pixels.

background.title: Background
background.description: Background properties to apply to the icon of the widget item when the item is hovered, focused or active.
background.markdownDescription: Background properties to apply to the icon of the widget item when the item is hovered, focused or active.

attachment.title: attachment
attachment.description: Set the background attachment of the component. [MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-attachment)
attachment.markdownDescription: Set the background attachment of the component. [MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-attachment)

color.title: color
color.description: Set the background color of the component.
color.markdownDescription: Set the background color of the component.

image.title: image
image.description:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".
image.markdownDescription:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

position.title: position
position.description: Set the background position of the component. [MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-position)
position.markdownDescription: Set the background position of the component. [MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-position)

size.title: size
size.description: Set the background size of the component. [MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-size)
size.markdownDescription: Set the background size of the component. [MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-size)

unsetBackground.title: Ignore Default Background
unsetBackground.description: Some components have a built-in background. In these scenarios setting this variable to true will remove the default background, even if other background properties are not specified.
unsetBackground.markdownDescription: Some components have a built-in background. In these scenarios setting this variable to true will remove the default background, even if other background properties are not specified.
